page.title: 11The History Of Bentley
page.content: The{local history}of Bentley begins in 1332 when Bentley Pauncefoot was established. There were two {manor {houses.}The most recent was built in the first half of the 19th century.It was bought by Mr Hemming in 1840. The Squire (Maude Mary Hemming) was born Dec.21st 1853. She married Mr Greycheape and died 1919. She was renowned for interest in the Worcestershire{Hunt}. The Manor was used for Italian and German prisoners during the{Second World War}. It was demolished in 1956 as it became too expensive to maintain. The remains were used to repair local{farms}and cottages on the estate. The estate now belongs to the Squire's son, retired in Scotlnd but is managed by his son living in Haselor. Pheasants are now bred on the site of the Manor.
